results.title: At least 5 children are missing as flash floods sweep through northern Turkey.
results.abstract: Dozens of people have been rescued from flood-hit areas since Wednesday.

multimedia.caption: An aerial view showing a flooded area after heavy rainfall near Kastamonu Province, in Turkey, on Wednesday.
multimedia.copyright: Demiroren News Agency, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: Wildfires in Algeria kill more than 60 people.
results.abstract: More than two dozen soldiers who were fighting the fires are among the dead.
results.byline: By Vivian Yee and Massinissa Benlakehal

multimedia.caption: Smoke billowing from a wildfire on Tuesday in the forested hills of the Kabyle region, east of Algiers.

results.title: Russia Brings a New Criminal Charge Against Navalny
results.abstract: The jailed opposition leader faces three additional years in prison — enough to keep him locked away until after the presidential election in 2024.

multimedia.caption: Aleksei A. Navalny on a video conference from prison during a court hearing in May.
multimedia.copyright: Dimitar Dilkoff/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: Greek Island Is New Epicenter of Europe’s Summer of Calamity
results.abstract: Evia was ravaged by wildfires this week, adding to the list of places that have fallen victim to extreme weather events made worse by climate change and scorching temperatures.

multimedia.caption: “We lived in paradise — now it’s hell”: Near the village of Vasilika on Tuesday.
multimedia.copyright: Eirini Vourloumis for The New York Times

results.title: U.K. Salon Industry Long Underserved Black Clients. It’s Vowing to Change That.
results.abstract: Even as many stylists see the new industry standards as significant, others worry that the change could take customers from existing Black-owned salons.
results.byline: By Aina J. Khan and Charlie Brinkhurst-Cuff

multimedia.caption: Marvina Newton having her hair styled at Elite Hair Studio in Armley. “I want to spend on Black businesses,” she said.
multimedia.copyright: Mary Turner for The New York Times

results.title: Thousands in Germany get extra shots after a nurse is suspected of tampering with the vaccine.
results.abstract: The nurse admitted to replacing six vaccine doses with a saline solution. The police suspect that she may have done so with many others during her time working at a clinic early this year.

multimedia.caption: Over 8,000 people who received vaccines in March and April near Wilhelmshaven, Germany, needed to receive additional doses as a precaution against a nurse who had swapped some doses for saline.
multimedia.copyright: Matthias Rietschel/Reuters
